data.text: On today's episode of #AskAustrian, Isabella Reichl explains how we supply you with all the necessary information that you need for travelling in times like these. Follow this link to watch the full episode:  https://t.co/qHT4vZEivy

data.text: FACC beliefert alle wichtigen Flugzeughersteller weltweit, wie auch @Airbus oder @Boeing. Es gibt kaum ein ✈️, in dem kein @facc_ag - Teil verbaut ist. #Flightcast hat ihren CEO Robert Machtlinger über die Krise und die Zukunftsaussichten interviewt: https://t.co/3w7rUWkGHk https://t.co/BEiV0cobV8

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world

data.text: It is self-evident that the COVID-19 pandemic also demands a lot from our crew: online training, stricter hygiene measures or the wearing of full-face masks. Verena Peruschitz, Head of Cabin Crews, reveals to us what has changed & how the crew is getting trained. 🛫 #AskAustrian

What do our adapted onboard services in our aircraft look like? In this #AskAustrian episode, Alice Ranzenbacher, Manager Austrian Product & Innovation, will tell you more about this subject and reveals how to protect yourself and others while flying. ✈️ https://t.co/wjK1yhvzIy

The health and safety of everyone onboard our aircraft is our highest priority. That's why wearing a face mask during your trip with us is mandatory. Thank you for helping us to protect all fellow passengers and crew! 😷 Find out more on our #AustrianBlog: https://t.co/c4SzehjCJv https://t.co/c2lKpfI8lr

data.text: RT @lufthansaNews: No rebooking fees @Lufthansa, @FlySWISS, @_Austrian, @FlyingBrussels: As of now, all fares can be rebooked several times…

In the next #AskAustrian episode, Sebastian Lüttmann, Senior Director Ground Operations Passenger & Aircraft Handling Hub Vienna, explains how processes at the airport work in times of COVID-19 and what measures are taken to guarantee a safe journey. 🛫 https://t.co/vdZEOYZIHT

data.text: Austrian and all other airlines of Lufthansa Group are restricting exceptions from compulsory masks as of 1 September. From then on flying without a mask is possible only with a medical certificate and negative Covid-19 test. https://t.co/CShZ25ulv4 https://t.co/yACVizH7Jx
It is indeed Bucharest. Congrats to everyone who got it right! 👍
We have another city quiz for you: Which one do you see here? Hint: One of this capital's nicknames is "Paris of the East". 😉 #FridayThoughts https://t.co/8rjWlqovgA

A safe and clean aircraft is essential when traveling - especially in times like these. 🛫😷 In our second #AskAustrian episode, we discuss how our planes are cleaned and what measures we take to ensure that you have a safe stay with us on board. ⤵️ https://t.co/KqdhwXQqFR

data.text: RT @lufthansaNews: Safe travel during the Corona pandemic: Lufthansa Group signs @EASA Charter. All Lufthansa Group airlines implement Euro…
@ennolenze This might be of interest to you. 😉😁

We are adding further destinations to our flight schedule. Starting today, we will fly to Erbil again. At the end of the month, we will also add Cologne to our program. The resumption of flights to Amman is planned for 3 September, and the restart to Tel Aviv for 14 September. https://t.co/YkHdMKmt4o

The air circulation system in our aircraft guarantee the best air quality on board and a complete exchange of air every three minutes. In the first #AskAustrian episode, our colleague Lukas Grabner explains how this system works. ⤵ https://t.co/XcYwqYrxNm
Wow, this was really quick! Of course Captains always sit on the left, except in exceptional cases like the first flight after the lockdown to Munich. There we had two flying caprains. 👨‍✈️👨‍✈️
BTW, the aircraft is named “Wiener Johann Strauss Orchester”, a long-standing partner of Austrian Airlines. @WJSO1966 https://t.co/WIlOd1PR2K

This is Rudi Buchsteiner, one of our Captains on the @embraer fleet. But there’s a small inaccuracy in the picture. A real live airliner would have no trouble finding it. Can you spot it? 🧐👨‍✈️ https://t.co/LMEJgdknKE
Podcast only available in German

„Als Chef einer Firma macht es keinen Spaß, Sanierungsschritte zu setzen oder ✈️ zu verkaufen. Genau das Gegenteil macht Spaß, und dorthin möchte ich auch kommen“, so CEO @AHoensbroech im Gespräch mit @MichaelCsoklich in der neuen Folge von #Flightcast https://t.co/4mIun1SfcM https://t.co/IyGzeZaqfV

data.text: “The freedom to travel is an important cornerstone of our modern-day society which should not be curtailed in the long term. Whoever is healthy and not infected should also be allowed to travel”, Austrian Airlines CEO von Hoensbroech stated. https://t.co/SaYxAa3uY0

data.text: Austrian Airlines CEO Alexis von Hoensbroech calls for comprehensive COVID-19 tests to be carried out on all passengers from high risk countries as a means of alleviating this situation. https://t.co/qHwZQ2CKdW
Press Conference: Half Year Results 2020 https://t.co/VoqnviGA4r
Notice: The conference will be held in German only.

data.text: We will start our press conference concerning our half year 2020 financial result at 11:00. You can follow the event via our livestream right here on our twitter channel. Stay tuned! https://t.co/ksqF9xS47s

As a result of the coronavirus crisis and the cessation of Austrian Airlines‘ flight operations for a period of close to three months, Austrian generated adj. EBIT of EUR -99mn in Q2 20, down from EUR +46mn in Q2/19. Adj EBIT for the 1st half of 2020 equaled EUR -235 million.

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text: Q2 Financial Results: „Corona crisis has hit the airline sector with full force. Worldwide travel restrictions almost completely brought flight operations to a standstill in the 2nd quarter. Business is slowly recovering since the resumption of flights”, says CFO Wolfgang Jani. https://t.co/lsrdINz28s

From September, we will also fly to the Canary Islands of Gran Canaria and Tenerife every Saturday. Thus we are adding ten holiday destinations to our summer program. These and other holiday flights can be booked on the Austrian Holidays website: https://t.co/yK8dmwCru4 https://t.co/T4ecaKq4xL

data.text: We are adding further holiday destinations to our summer flight schedule. Kalamata, Preveza, Skiathos and Skiros are already back since the beginning of August. Cagliari, Olbia, Catania and Ibiza are also operated again. All flights take place once a week on Saturdays or Sundays. https://t.co/rBdv0T6Vxi
After our first arrival in Kyiv for months on last Saturday, the airport had a little surprise for us. Thanks for the great water salute! We are happy to be back! 🇺🇦✈️🇦🇹 https://t.co/Eoh5V5UhAr
It actually is Moscow. Our B777 was on the way to Xiamen to collect another shipment of medical cargo. Congrats to everyone who got it right, well done! 👍

data.text: One thing we dearly missed during our operational break due to Corona were the marvelous in-flight pics of our crews - like the one below. Can you guess which city this is? Hint: This photo was taken from a Boeing 777. 😉 #TuesdayVibes https://t.co/kDxzrxaYw6

data.text: Flights to Bucharest, Chicago, Pristina and Sarajevo are to be offered as early as today, July 31. From August 1, we will be flying again to Belgrade, Cairo, Kiev, London, Podgorica, Sibiu, Skopje, Sofia, Stockholm, Tirana and Varna.

The expiry of the landing bans tonight makes an extentsion of our summer flight scheduling possible. We'll resume flights to 15 destinations today and tomorrow. Team Austrian is looking forward to welcome you back on board. 👩‍✈️✈️ https://t.co/Wp9k7GHv0V

data.text:
From the picturesque Shipwreck Beach to the lonely Dafni Beach and the Blue Caves. On this week's #AustrianBlog we show you the beauty of the island and what the perfect holiday on Zakynthos might look like: https://t.co/fRxnUfU6pE 🏖🇬🇷

#ServusOnBoard https://t.co/PSrLczNZbi
Picture © on the right: Schleinzer - @flughafen_wien

Yesterday our 100th medical cargo flight landed in Vienna. Since the end of March we have transported about 1,800 tons of medical equipment in the fight against #COVID19 to Europe. Another B777 is currently being loaded in Xiamen and is expected to return to Vienna tomorrow. https://t.co/hSuNkVBhyR

Passengers who wish to take their flight at a later date have various rebooking options and can start their rebooked journey up until the end of 2021. On the Austrian Airlines website, passengers will find up-to-date information on current developments: https://t.co/b2IT5actUU
Passengers whose flights were cancelled and who do not want to make use of the rebooking options can apply for a refund using the online form on the Austrian Airlines website: https://t.co/hJieL2jO9c

data.text: “Together with the authorities and the airport, we want and must find a solution for transfer traffic in order to prevent uncontrolled entry as fast as possible”, the Austrian Airlines CCO continues.

data.text: - We advocate a uniform and stable travel policy within the EU so as not to weaken Vienna's position as a hub in the long term. Business travelers and other transfer passengers will otherwise find alternative ways of getting to long-haul destinations”, says CCO Andreas Otto.

“Of course, we understand that health is a top priority in the current situation. It remains a common goal to contain the pandemic. However, cross-the-board travel bans for entire countries - with extremely short notice - are an enormous challenge for us and our guests. -
Belgrade, Bucharest, Cairo, Kyiv, London, Podgorica, Pristina, Sarajevo, Sibiu, Skopje, Sofia, Stockholm, Tirana and Varna.

data.text: The Austrian Health Ministry has expanded its list of landing bans. Starting tomorrow, flights from the following countries, among others, won’t be permitted to land in Austria: Albania, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Egypt, Kosovo, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Romania & Serbia. https://t.co/CBJswBPqDG
Our crew is happy to be up in the air again. 🛫 But see for yourself - we have collected some impressions from their first days at work ⤵ https://t.co/QfjeIRHX2t

Your safety is our top priority ✈️ Our aircraft are equipped with HEPA filters that guarantee the best air quality on board and a complete exchange of air every three minutes. They remove 99,9% of all viruses, bacteria and other particles-including coronaviruses. https://t.co/iuyc9atqGw

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text:
On our website, passengers will find up-to-date information on travel in times of corona, flight schedules, mask requirement, entry or rebooking regulations: https://t.co/DykO5KQmJw 

The information is updated on an ongoing basis. 

Copyright for all pictures: @alexcheban 🙏 https://t.co/eVyW51PkSu

We are also increasing capacity on almost all routes from September onwards. This means more flights and larger aircraft, for example to Amsterdam, Brussels, Bucharest, Copenhagen, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt & Paris with up to three daily flights, Athens with up to two daily flights. https://t.co/2TWHsYzT7k

Starting in August, we will fly to Shanghai again – initially once a week. From September onwards, we will add further routes, which we will operate up to once a day. This concerns Chişinău, Dnipro, Iaşi, Klagenfurt, Leipzig, Lviv, Lyon, Nuremberg, Odessa and Yerevan. https://t.co/5ruRwGRoKs

Today we have published our remaining summer flight schedule 2020, which will run until the end of October. By then, we will double our offer from the current 20 percent to almost 40 percent compared to previous year's schedule. Over 60 destinations will be back in the program. https://t.co/AMYrDQ1wWp

We know you have many questions regarding refunds. We are constantly processing refunds and each week several thousands of tickets are being reimbursed. We are working full steam to process all remaining requests as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience and understanding. https://t.co/xfWAY3DYHb

data.text: In the future, Wolfgang Jani will devote himself to new projects outside of the Lufthansa Group. Accordingly, the Executive Board will be reduced in size and be comprised of CEO @AHoensbroech and CCO & CFO Andreas Otto. COO @JensRitter_JR belongs to the extended Executive Board.

data.text: Austrian Airlines CFO Wolfgang Jani will leave the company at the end of August. The vacant Management Board position with responsibility for “Finance” will not be filled. Instead, CCO Andreas Otto will take on the duties previously handled by Mr. Jani effective 1 September 2020. https://t.co/jMAhjGr3FH

Yesterday evening we’ve received green light from the European Commission for our Corona aid package. With this news nearly all prerequisites for the implementation of the package have now been fulfilled and we are able to take-off again with full-thrust.🇪🇺🛫 https://t.co/RtWPMTG1be

data.text: Another great first: Just in time for summer holidays the first @tui_at charter flight took of to Heraklion from @flughafen_wien. We’re happy to see that wanderlust is coming back again.😍👌🏼 #servusanbord https://t.co/kNSoeWsXAv
Picture Copyright Train: ÖBB/Harald Eisenberger

Guests will enjoy various advantages of AIRail, for example a guaranteed connection. This means passengers, who miss their connecting flight or train due to an unexpected late arrival of the train or aircraft, will be automatically rebooked on an alternative travel connection.

From plane to train for a better climate: Together with @unsereOEBB up to 31 AIRail trains will operate daily between Salzburg Central Station and Vienna Airport as of 20 July. This is more than a tenfold increase. In contrast, we won't resume flights between Salzburg and Vienna. https://t.co/O6ihb3jTR9

In less than an hour OS 89 - one of our first regular long-haul flights in over 100 days - will land @EWRairport. Here are a view more impressions from the start this morning @flughafen_wien - appropriate to the occasion in "Kaiserwetter" (meaning "great weather" in German 😉). https://t.co/Bx0LVXtQYP
After a break of more than 100 days our first regular long-haul flights took off today heading to New York, Chicago and Washington. Happy to be back! 🇺🇸🇦🇹🛫 https://t.co/ntbiNwPoy6
As a result we unfortunately had to cancel our planned flights to London, Milan, Stockholm and Kyiv. We apologize to all passengers affected and ask for their understanding.

data.text: We are expanding our flight schedule. As of July, we will start flying to Palma de Mallorca and Zadar. Moreover, we are doubling the number of flights to Dubrovnik and Split to up to six connections per week. There will also be more flights to Thessaloniki and Nice. 😎🏖️ https://t.co/PfxUFo9aRZ

data.text: RT @lufthansaNews: Shareholders pave the way for stabilization measures. 98 percent vote to approve at Extraordinary General Meeting. Carst…

The damage at our IT data centre caused by a water pipe burst was brought under control. All systems are being restarted. The website is online and the ☎️ line of our service centers is working again. We apologize to all those affected for the inconvenience caused!
Systems are getting restarted. Our webpage https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z is online again. 📱💻👍

Unfortunately, the IT system failure caused by water damage 💦 has not yet been resolved. Our website and service centre 📞 are still down. Our IT experts are continuing to work with full commitment to solve the problem. 🧰🔧 Updates will follow. Please excuse the inconveniences.
We are working flat out to solve the problem and are currently in the process of switching to our backup system. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Due to water damage at Vienna Airport, which unfortunately also affected the Austrian Airlines computer center, our IT systems failed early this afternoon. Among other things, our website https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z and the telephone systems of our service centers were affected. https://t.co/YN9CBJJvwL

Due to a technical problem our website https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z as well as our call center are currently not available. We are working on a solution and will keep you updated. Please excuse any inconvenience.

data.text: For the increased flight schedule, we will deploy 36 aircraft from July onwards, i.e. almost half of our fleet. These include three Boeing 767 as well as mostly smaller aircraft such as Airbus A319, Embraer 195 and Dash 8. https://t.co/u0psQUxXJb

Starting in July, we will fly to over 50 destinations. These include various European capitals and major cities, Greek holiday islands and long-haul destinations. In total, the restart offer will quadruple from initially five to 20 percent of last year's program. https://t.co/PlKJsexqdf

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text: In times of #COVID19 health and safety are even more important than usual. That's why we have taken extensive measures to ensure carefree flying. You can find more information in our step-by-step instructions on the #AustrianBlog: https://t.co/4X96IUwjKf https://t.co/Pg33stu46l

Wir fliegen wieder und auch der @flughafen_wien fährt den Betrieb wieder hoch. #Flightcast war beim Erstflug von #Wien nach @MUC_Airport dabei und hat dabei viele spannende Stimmen eingeholt: https://t.co/WevTuFIySy (Podcast only German) @AHoensbroech 🎙🧑‍✈️👩‍✈️🛫 https://t.co/IlkuR6ATDG
Was great to have you on board, Mr Foreign Minister! 🙏 https://t.co/mLjN63SO6m
Thanks @Flugthier for the pics! 🙏
A few impressions from our first flight after the corona break yesterday. 📸😊 @AHoensbroech https://t.co/EM26MEmDZx
Press Conference: "Fliegen in Zeiten von Corona" https://t.co/74t4rJeFeb
Austrian Airlines is back in the skies! ✌️🇦🇹🛫 https://t.co/hn9xbOZjf7
Off we go! 👋 Follow OS 111 live ⁦@flightradar24⁩ https://t.co/M6JzdXgw5b

data.text:
We are back in our best suit 🇦🇹 We are boarding for our first flight and can't wait to take off again! 🛫 #ReadyToFly #ServusOnBoard

P.S. Follow our first flight #OS111 live in our Instagram Stories: https://t.co/XgnljobX4S https://t.co/QFu0xTKyek
5:30 in the morning, all volunteers here to greet our first passengers after almost 90 days of grounding. Simply amazing ... ❤️❤️❤️ https://t.co/ChNj55l4S2

domain.name: Entities [Entity Service]
domain.description: Entity Service top level domain, every item that is in Entity Service should be in this domain

data.text:
Tomorrow! 🛫❤️ #ReadyToFly

P.S.: Our first flight will take off to Munich as OS 111. Follow it live on our Instagram channel tomorrow morning: https://t.co/XgnljobX4S https://t.co/9nTbgFhO0X
We are cleared for take-off and #ReadyToFly! Starting on Monday, we will discover the world with you again. See ya then! 🛫 💃 🕺 https://t.co/xvWW3aJujW

Three days to go! Our crew is making sure that everything is in the right place for your comfort on board. We can’t wait to greet you with a "Servus" again on Monday! 😉 🛫#ReadyToFly https://t.co/DZJgkK745H

Wie fährt man einen Flugbetrieb wieder hoch? Und wohin fliegt man mit welchem Flugzeug? #Flightcast hat mit dem @_austrian Netzchef Robert Heusmann gesprochen, um den sogenannten „Ramp-Up“ nach der Pandemie besser zu verstehen: https://t.co/OSaWr8Wkvr (Podcast only German) 🛫 https://t.co/w2kyTcEw5h

We are eagerly waiting to take you to your destinations - even to those that may not be so easy to pronounce at the first attempt😉. That's why our colleagues have practiced a little to get in shape for Monday. 🛫 #ReadyToFly
P.S.: Don't forget to turn on the sound! 🔈 https://t.co/22jlFzipnI

Less than a week until we are finally taking off again. 🛫 Our colleagues have been working tirelessly to complete all checks, especially the small ones, to get our aircraft #ReadyToFly! 😉😁 https://t.co/G6gxBdMc1P
Press Conference: Financial Aid Agreement https://t.co/O3PPFNoBc0

data.text: In roughly 10 minutes Austrian Airlines CEO @AHoensbroech and Lufthansa Group CEO Carsten Spohr will hold a press conference on the financial aid agreement reached today. Follow it live on our Twitter channel (German spoken language). @lufthansaNews https://t.co/30ExvnFiup

data.text: Today is a special day for us. Our CEO @AHoensbroech gives you an update on the financial aid agreement reached between the Austrian Federal Government, Lufthansa and Austrian Airlines. We are looking forward to welcome you on board again soon! 🛫 #ReadyToFly https://t.co/aorHx7Wdnn
Summertime here we come! 😎 #ReadyToFly https://t.co/WWDWM5ffYj
